content.description: Similar dirty start as its neighbor Humane Bomb. Tenuous starts gives way to more moderate climbing. After a rest on a a ledge tackle the tricky roof sequence
content.protection: No more than 10 bolts and ring anchors.

content.description: Climb great quality rock to a conglomerate jug rest (with good feet).  This bolt has a bail biner on it because you are about to get sucker punched!  The next few moves are uncharacteristically hard for what you previously endured.  Find your way to the next bolt and easy into the anchors.
content.location: Just left of Mitch's Bitch (2nd route to the left of the seasonal waterfall)

content.description: The super fun route starts out sketchy on the "green wall." Ease up to the 3rd bolt and get ready for some sick moves on small crimps.  Work on up to a small nook near the top.  There are several nice hands to rest and poke your head up to scope the crux.  Build up some power to pull over the roof and clip the chains!
content.location: Just left of Sucker Punch (3rd route to the left of the season waterfall) and just right of a tree close to the wall.  The start area is covered in green algae stuff.

content.description: A frisky 5.7+ it really earns the "+"
content.protection: 5 bolts plus two shiny anchor hangars with nice rings
content.location: Look for a couple of cedar trees 50'up and you should see the anchors. About 6-8 feet to the right of these, are anchors for 'HeSaid, She Said"

content.description: From DCA:   Starts just left of Left Hook. The name says it all. Finish over the big roof.
content.protection: Feel around to find and clip the bolt at lip from ledge below the roof.  Rest up then fire the roof (crux) on decent holds, heel hook and stand up. Anchors and rap rings above.

content.description: Moderate climbing to a stout sequence thru the roof.  Anchors just above the roof.
content.location: Starts on the third set of bolts climbers right from the seasonal wet streak and splits to the right at the second bolt.  The only clearly splitting bolt lines in this area.

content.description: Start on left of the face inside a chimney. Stout face climbing leads to a crux move on thin holds before a ledge rest. Second crux pulls out on to an easier face before a tricky finish at the chains. Route is a touch dirty and can be wet at times. Awesome views at the top.
content.location: Inside the chimney feature at the far end of the area

content.description: Taller route than he said she said but similar climbing style.
content.location: Second bolted route to the right of the large crack

content.description: Easy climbing leads to roof/flake system.  Decipher the chalked holds and boulder up and into the dihedral.  Continue up to a fantastic stance on the arete then to the anchors.
content.location: On the left side of seasonal waterfall - opposite Holy War.

content.description: Start just below the ledge, 50 feet left of Panty Raid and behind the flake.
Moderate thru the first three bolts with a well protected tough move over the roof.  Anchors are just above the roof and there is a bolt on the face of it that is hard to see from the ground.
content.location: Starts on the third set of bolts climbers right from the seasonal wet streak and splits to the left at the second bolt.  The only clearly splitting bolt lines in this area.

content.description: Fight your way through shrubbery past a small right facing corner and onto a platform where the real fun starts. Fairly sustained climbing will take you past several roofs and to the anchors.
content.protection: No more than 10 bolts and ring anchors.
content.location: First route coming down the trail from the direction of the Falls.

content.description: Argued to be the best of the grade at Foster Falls. I would agree. The climbing is pretty continuous and interesting with a wide variety of moves - crimps, jugs, flakes and even a mono pocket!
content.location: Just to the right of a (seasonal) waterfall on the Wall of Useless Conflict.

content.description: He Said (9) She Said (10c) with the crux about 1/2 way up second pitch.
content.protection: Bolts, with anchors and links at the end of the first pitch.  Will need to make anchors off the trees on the ledge for second pitch.

content.description: Start at the bottom of the face and take the ride to the top.

Wide range of routes with a high concentration of 11s.    Routes from right to left.   Humane Bomb 11a   Tit for Tat 11a   Right Hook 11d   Left Hook 11a   Shock and Awe 11b/c   Holy War 9   Mitch's B!*(% 10d   Sucker Punch 11a   Smear Queer and Fear 11b   Good vs. Evil 11a   He Said, She Said 9   Sibling Rivalry 7+   Panty Raid 9   Puss and Boots 11b
